research.What is the average franchise margin for: The average net profit margin for fast food franchises typically ranges from 6% to 9% (2024) [Source: Franshares - https://franshares.com/the-most-profitable-fast-food-franchises-of-2024]
research.What are the typical lease renewal costs: Specific lease renewal costs for QSR franchises are not available. Franchise agreements typically last 10-20 years, with renewal fees often a percentage of the initial franchise fee or sales. [Source: Franzy - https://franzy.com/blog/average-franchise-fees]
research.How do lease renewals impact profitabili: Lease renewals significantly impact profitability. One franchisee faced a nearly 30% rent increase upon renewal, prompting relocation. Rent management is crucial for success. [Source: QSR Magazine - https://www.qsrmagazine.com/story/how-some-restaurant-franchisees-are-adapting-to-2024s-economic-realities]
research.What are the competitive benchmarks for: Lease agreements typically involve 5-10 year terms. Total occupancy costs should be 6%-10% of gross sales. QSRs trade at an average cap rate of 5.44%. [Source: Avison Young - https://www.avisonyoung.us/documents/d/netlease/2024_qsr_sector_report-ay]
research.What is the average lease term for QSR f: The average lease term for QSR franchises is 5-20 years. Longer terms justify upfront costs. [Source: Occupier.com - https://www.occupier.com/blog/leasing-restaurant-space]
research.What percentage of QSR franchise costs a: Exact percentage of costs attributed to lease renewals is not available. Rising occupancy costs impact franchisees. [Source: QSR Magazine - https://www.qsrmagazine.com/story/how-some-restaurant-franchisees-are-adapting-to-2024s-economic-realities]
